《科学中的革命》 科恩 著
课堂人数 ≤15人， 讨论与引导式讲授结合，文理科兼容。课前需充分准备，从一而终，慎选！
创新思维是引领研究工作的重要航标。本课程以讨论与穿插讲授的方式，通过一系列的主题分析和讨论，逐步领悟和建立科学创新思维。主要内容包括如何洞悉事物不同、明晰差异标准、确立研究命题价值等。由于知解观察依赖六根辩分，囿于其限而难得全貌，科学结论必然为境界性存在，科学知识亦为阶段性结果。不执常规认识，随顺流化，因境而用，巧思立新自然水到渠成。

绿色产品和技术的生命周期评价
Life Cycle Assessment of Green Products and Technology

讲授生命周期评价（LCA）方法以及软件工具和数据库的使用，并讲授LCA方法在各行业低碳绿色循环发展中的交叉研究案例，包括清洁技术研发与评价、产品生态设计、清洁生产管理、环境标志与声明、产品环境政策等方面的案例。
通过课堂讨论和小组专题研究，帮助学生全面掌握LCA方法和工具，培养自身专业与资源环境保护相结合的交叉研究能力。

各种资源环境问题主要是由于产品的生产和消费活动（即产品生命周期过程）直接造成的，而产品生产和消费方式取决于技术研究、产品设计、生产管理、供应链管理、乃至环境标识制度与产品环境政策。因此量化地分析产品生命周期资源环境影响，可以系统地寻找最有效的改进途径，是实现资源环境保护目标的基础，也是本课程内容的最终目的。
本课程分为两个部分，第一部分讲授生命周期评价（LCA）的理论方法以及软件和数据库的使用，包括LCA方法框架与标准要求（ISO14040系列等）、建模与数据收集方法指南、算法原理、评价指标及中国本地化指标、改进分析与数据质量评估等，及其实际操作与案例研究演示。第二部分通过实际的应用案例，讲授和讨论LCA方法在技术研发评价、产品生态设计、清洁生产管理、碳足迹/水足迹/环境足迹等环境标志与声明、绿色采购、绿色供应链管理、产品环境政策以及循环经济、低碳经济等方面的实际应用案例。
通过本课程的系统学习，可以使得学生全面了解和掌握生命周期思想、生命周期评价及生命周期管理的核心内容，加深对可持续发展的认识,为将来从事可持续消费与生产领域的研究和创新工作提供基础性的知识和工具。

课堂人数10人左右，最好有一定计算机基础

本课程主要介绍植物分类、数据挖掘、图像识别、生物大数据分析基本理论和算法等，并在校园和野外进行实习实践，是一门整合了多个学科的跨专业课程，具有很强的通用性和实用性。本课程面向本校生物科学、生态学、计算生物学和计算机科学相关专业的学生开设，预期通过理论学习和实地考察，让学生们在课堂实践中学习植物物种数据库比对、建立图像识别模型、开发移动客户端程序，建立基于人工智能和深度学习校园植物的批量分科鉴定系统。此外，课程还包括暑期峨眉山野外实习，在峨眉山完成课程的实习实践部分（可选）。

The course starts with a general introduction into international political economy with a focus on the state of the art and the main questions that this field of research focuses on. The course proceeds then with the analysis of state behavior with respect to market opening, both for international trade and international capital movements. In doing so, an approach is used in which (a) a theory is presented, (b) criticized for its weaknesses and gaps, and (c) a new theory is presented that partly covers these weaknesses and gaps. Following this, criticisms and weaknesses of this new theory are highlighted after which still another one is presented, and so on. The strategy is here to gradually and cumulatively reduce the residual (unexplained) variance that is left by theories that try to explain said state behavior. This happens through detailed attention for hypothesis development (and the causal mechanisms that undergird these hypotheses) and hypothesis testing, either quantitatively or qualitatively (whatever is appropriate). The course would cover the following eight modules:？Module 1: What is international political economy?？Module 2: Neorealist Hegemonic Stability Theory and International Economic Cooperation or the Lack Thereof: the case of China’s Rise and the Bretton Woods Institutions？Module 3: Drivers and Impediments of international economic cooperation: the Modified Mundell-Fleming Model and preferences on monetary and exchange rate policies？Module 4: Trade liberalization and the political demand for protection: the role of aggregate and distributional effects？Module 5: Trade liberalization and the political demand for protection: the role of factor specificity？Module 6: Trade liberalization and the political demand for protection: the role of inter- versus intra-industry trade？Module 7: Trade liberalization and the political demand for protection: the dynamic impact of market openingModule 8: Detecting the impact of loss aversion and the rise of Populism in Western Europe and the United States
Promoting Mental Health in Leadership: Wellness in the Workplace
Promoting Mental Health in Leadership: Wellness in the Workplace

Working with groups can be a significant source of stress and leaders that understand principles of mental health and group dynamics can provide structure to promote wellness. Building safety, cohesion, and structured communication can reduce stress and increase productivity. This course will cover counseling concepts and interventions that may be applied in leaderships applications in the workplace. A primary component will be how group dynamics can lead to greater well-being for those you are leading.Objectives: 1.Learn group dynamics such as stages and therapeutic factors of group.2.Identify definitions of mental health and applicability in work life.Apply techniques that will promote mental wellness across differing leadership paradigms.

The course provides an advanced understanding of the contribution ofeconomic analysis to the solution of environmental problems. In addition, itseeks to provide students with the skills necessary to analyze and discusscurrent policy issues concerning the protection of the environment.？ In addition to presenting the background to the problem ofenvironmental degradation, externalities and public goods, topics willbe drawn from the following list:？ Double dividends of environmental taxation？ Voluntary agreements？ International environmental problems？ Economics of natural resources？ Kuznets curves？ Sustainability and environmental indicatorsThe course is intended for level 3 (final year) students in Economics and otherquantitative subjects.

The course provides students with knowledge as well as analytical and problem-solving skills in the field of public economics. The focus is on second-best analysis, though first best and third best will also be covered. Topics included are, commodity taxation, non-linear labour income taxation, capital income taxation, public expenditure. There is also an introduction to Public Choice aspects of tax policy, as well as Fiscal Federalism. This course is intended for level 3 and final level students in Economics related disciplines.

计算机应用设计（单片机）
随着时代的发展，传统的51单片机已经无法满足人们的需求，目前人们常用的控制核心有STM32单片机与恩智浦的K60或K66系列，本课程通过教授一些新的单片机编程方法及应用让学生对一些新型高级的单片机编程方法有所了解
双特生除了在自己的特色方向上有所专长外，还应该保证一定的阅读量，阅读的书籍也包括了特色方向的书籍，这样可以让双特生的视野更加开阔，在以后看待问题时可以从多个方面看待问题，这对于双特生来说是很重要的
